p: This inequity—as appalling as it is—may still underestimate the problem, as data remain woefully incomplete. Despite calls for comprehensive, nationwide data on COVID‐19 cases and deaths by race and socioeconomic status, the U.S. federal government has no such system in place, and journalists and scholars have stepped in to collate disaggregated data by race from a patchwork of state health departments. The need for better data remains.
